member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.OpenInTerminalCommandHandler
member.summary: Class used to instantiate the "Open in Terminal" command. This command is implemented using the legacy VSCT for folder, project, and solution nodes in Solution View in a local context. Folder View implementation can be found under the AnyCode repo. Codespace Solution View implementation can be found in the VS repo under the UIInternal solution. Codespace Folder View implementation can be found in the LiveShare repo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.OpenInTerminalCommandHandler.InitializeCommandAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowPackage)
member.summary: Initializes the solution view "Open in Terminal" command.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.OpenInTerminalCommandHandler.Execute(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowPackage)
member.summary: Executes this command using the legacy VSCT implementation. This acquires the selected item in the Solution Explorer using the DTE, acquires the file path of the item, and opens a new terminal using the terminal service.
member.param: Terminal package used to acquire profiles and JTF.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.OpenInTerminalCommandHandler.OnBeforeQueryStatus(System.Object)
member.summary: Event handler that gets called when a context menu is opened in the Solution Explorer. Currently this command should only show up under: - Solution nodes - Project nodes - Physical folder nodes.

member.summary: The window frame event cookie used to register for window frame events.

member.summary: The terminal package.

member.summary: This tool window's window state ID.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.uiShell
member.summary: The UiShell used to register for window frame events.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.serviceBroker
member.summary: The service broker service used to acquire ISB services.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.serviceHookSemaphore
member.summary: JoinableTaskFactory aware semaphore that prevents the terminal intitialization if a solution is being loaded or a remote connection is being created.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.userInputSemaphore
member.summary: JoinableTaskFactory aware semaphore that limits writing to the rendererWriterStream. This prevents missed keystrokes when the user types faster than the stream can flush.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.renderWriterStream
member.summary: Tool window Renderer writing stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.terminalServiceStreamWriters
member.summary: StreamWriters that this tool window should write to in order to forward terminal content to other terminal tool windows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.debuggerService
member.summary: Debugger service interface used to register when the debug mode changes. Null if EnableDebugModeSwitchPersistanceAsync was never called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.debuggerEventCookie
member.summary: Cookie returned from IVsDebugger.AdviseDebuggerEvents. Zero if EnableDebugModeSwitchPersistanceAsync was never called.

member.summary: Gets the Terminal tool window guid, used solely for base-class methods.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.PendingFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets the control pending focus. This is needed because the current VS focus system does not meet the terminal's requirements. A static window pending focus needs to be set so that focus does not flash between two windows as a result of the active frame changed event.

member.summary: Implementation of IVsDebuggerEvents.OnModeChange.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.EnableDebugModeSwitchPersistanceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Updates this terminal so that it will not be automatically hidden when switching between debug and design mode. This also shows the terminal if it is currently hidden to guard against the case that the shell hid the window between creation and when EnableDebugModeSwitchPersistanceAsync completes.
member.returns: Task to indicate when this operation completes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.WaitForInitAsync
member.summary: Task used to notify when the terminal has been initialized.
member.returns: A representing when the terminal has finished initializing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.AttachStreamAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Attaches a stream to the terminal PTY. Attached streams will act as remote renderers where input will be treated as user input and output comes from the PTY.
member.param: Stream to attach to the PTY.
Cancellation token for this async task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Terminal.TerminalWindowBase.PreProcessMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Override PreProcessMessage specifically so that we can consume the escape key when the focus is on the terminal tool window. This prevents the editor from gaining focus since it's a reserved global hotkey.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.FreeLibrarySafeHandle
member.summary: Represents a Win32 handle that can be closed with .

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.FreeLibrary(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HINSTANCE)
member.summary: Frees the loaded dynamic-link library (DLL) module and, if necessary, decrements its reference count.

param.name: hLibModule
param.para: A handle to the loaded library module. The LoadLibrary, LoadLibraryEx, GetModuleHandle, or GetModuleHandleEx function returns this handle.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call the GetLastError function.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.LoadLibrary(Windows.Win32.Foundation.PCWSTR)
member.summary: Loads the specified module into the address space of the calling process.

param.name: lpLibFileName
param.para: The name of the module. This can be either a library module (a .dll file) or an executable module (an .exe file). The name specified is the file name of the module and is not related to the name stored in the library module itself, as specified by the LIBRARY keyword in the module-definition (.def) file. If the string specifies a full path, the function searches only that path for the module. If the string specifies a relative path or a module name without a path, the function uses a standard search strategy to find the module; for more information, see the Remarks. If the function cannot find the module, the function fails. When specifying a path, be sure to use backslashes (\\), not forward slashes (/). For more information about paths, see Naming a File or Directory. If the string specifies a module name without a path and the file name extension is omitted, the function appends the default library extension .dll to the module name. To prevent the function from appending .dll to the module name, include a trailing point character (.) in the module name string.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the module. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.
